com.mordoch.chemtools.formulatools

Class FormulaHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mordoch.chemtools.formulatools.FormulaHelper

  • public class FormulaHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    The sole purpose of this class is to offload excess methods from Formula.
    Since:
    0.6.8-alpha
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    Ariel Mordoch

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      FormulaHelper(LookupTable table)
      Since parseFormula(String) uses a LookupTable, pass a LookupTable reference when creating a FormulaHelper.

    • Method Detail

      • parseFormula

        public Formula parseFormula(java.lang.String formulaToParse)
        This method takes a string such as "C6H12O6" and adds the elements, subscripts, and coefficients into a Formula object. This makes it much easier to get relevant data like the elements in the formula and their subscripts later. There are a number of rules to follow:
        1. If a formula contains only 1 atom of a given element and multiple atoms of another element, it must be explicitly stated, e.g. carbon dioxide becomes "C1O2".
        2. If a formula contains a coefficient, it must be written within parenthesis, e.g. "(.5)O2"
        3. Fractional coefficients must be input as decimals.
        Parameters:
        formulaToParse - a string such as "C6H12O6" to parse
        Returns:
        a Formula object representing formulaToParse

      • parseEquation

        public Equation parseEquation(java.lang.String equationToParse)
        Takes an equation in string form, such as "H2 + (.5)O2 ---> H2O1", and returns an Equation object representing that equation. This method splits the reactants and products into individual formulas using parseFormula(String), so keep in mind that the equation's parts must be syntactically compatible with it. In order for this method function, the reactants and products must be separated by the sequence '--->' exactly.
        Parameters:
        equationToParse - a string containing the equation to parse
        Returns:
        an Equation object representing the given equation
